oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Sgt. James R. Burton to his parents
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Sgt. James R. Burton, Co. A, 19th Ky. Inf., USA, wrote to his parents James and Elizabeth Burton from Louisiana in a camp near Vicksburg, Miss. He wants to know people at home are saying about "poly ticks in our country" because heard that people at home were "cutting up considerable over the proclamation of our president," likely the Emancipation Proclamation. Burton said that people in "this country" were also "cut up over the proclamation."
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, Davidson County, Tennessee
